newsitem.title: MEXICO: Ahmsa Q2 steel output up but sales off.
newsitem.headline: Ahmsa Q2 steel output up but sales off.

text.p: Mexican steel company Altos Hornos de Mexico (Ahmsa) said on Thursday its sales volume rose by 4.4 percent in the second quarter from the year-ago period, but lower steel prices dragged down sales income.
The company said in a statement its sales income fell by 2.2 percent to 2.900 billion pesos for the quarter because of a 12 percent drop in steel prices.
"Despite unforeseen shutdowns of operational equipment and low steel prices, the company is able to maintain operating margins and satisfy customer needs," Ahmsa said.
Liquid steel production rose in the quarter by 0.46 percent to 849,662 tonnes, while steel product sales rose by 4.4 percent to 748,374 tonnes.
"Ahmsa's Blast Furnace No. 5 was shut down for nine days due to a severe hail storm. Production was affected by 54,740 tonnes of liquid steel," the company said.
Ahmsa's operating margin for the quarter was 16.3 percent, one percentage point lower than in 1996, the company said.
Ahmsa is in the midst of an almost $1 billion modernization plan, expected to wrap up in 1998 and reduce energy and operation costs.

The company said it began operating a new coal coating line in June. In coming months it will begin operating a new oxygen and argon plant, coal injection units and a distribution center for high-tech means and structures, Ahmsa added.
